full_text: 1 He had like not white hair but it was, not white but it, you know, it was kind of like, like me. It was like..... I don't know. 2 MP: He was going gray. 3 Yes. He was going gray. And he had... 4 MP: What color hair did he have before? Blonde, brown? 5 No. 6 MP: You were describing Jeff to me, with the freckle and he was going gray and what else? 7 Um, like he, like his skin color is like, when I saw him, when you have a sunburn, but its like when you have it a couple of days and it's turning into a tan. It was like a reddish tannish color. And he had like a long face and that's about all I can remember and he had a white t shirt when he first came in. 8 MP: Okay. 9 I don't really remember... 10 MP: Did he have any kind of like jewelry on his body that you noticed? 11 I didn't, I don't remember. 12 MP: Okay. Do you remember what color eyes he had? 13 Nope. 14 MP: Did he have any facial hair, like a mustache? Or a goatee or anything? 15 Hmm....No but his eyebrows were really thick and they were bushy, like everywhere. 16 MP: Okay. Did he ever ask you to do anything other than massaging him? 17 No. Page 34 of 43 07/26/17 Page 49 of 81 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031141

additional_notes: The document appears to be a transcript of an interview. The interviewee is describing a person named Jeff. There are some redactions in the form of blacked-out text.
